citeinfo.origin: Minnesota DNR - Division of Lands & Minerals
citeinfo.title: State Lands - Volstead

pubinfo.publish: Minnesota DNR - Division of Lands & Minerals

descript.abstract: State Volstead Lands mapped to the PLS forty level. This layer merges the DNR Control Point Generated PLS layer with IBM mainframe-based land records. The data are limited to a forty level resolution. Therefore, holdings that are less than a forty in extent are represented as a full forty in the data (although specific fields exist within the attribute tables that allow the user to identify these). Detailed discussion on the issues associated with the application of this data can be found at: http://intranet.dnr.state.mn.us/mis/gis/pdf/landrecords_read.pdf
descript.purpose: To provide Minnesota DNR resource managers and land records specialists access to State Volstead Lands information in GIS format.

dataqual.logic: Topologically verified using ArcInfo 8.x prior to conversion to shapefile format.

horizpa.horizpar: Source layer pls40ne3: Variable. At its least accurate, the data is based upon points derived from manual digitizing of PLS section corners from 1:24,000 scale paper media (GISMO and SECTIC-24K points). At its most accurate, the data is based upon points collected using GPS units operating at a sub-meter level of accuracy. Refer to the ACCURACY and METHOD fields in the related PLS Control Point layer (cornrpt3), for specific information.

distbrep.distres: Source layer pls40ne3: Variable. At its least accurate, the data is based upon points derived from manual digitizing of PLS section corners from 1:24,000 scale paper media (GISMO and SECTIC-24K points). At its most accurate, the data is based upon points collected using GPS units operating at a sub-meter level of accuracy. Refer to the ACCURACY and METHOD fields in the related PLS Control Point layer (cornrpt3), for specific information.

overview.eaover:
Data Elements for Attribute Table ADM_ALLLNDPY3.DBF:
COUN: County identified using a 2-digit number from 1 to 87.
TOWN: PLS township number. If the township number ends with ".5", it is the half township - 58.5, range 17.
RANG: PLS range number
SECT: PLS section number
GLOT: PLS government lot number
PARC: Parcel number - currently not used. The original intent of this field was to use this code in relation to the forty or government lot to identify unique parcels.
FORT_DESC: PLS forty (quarter-quarter) description using text. The descriptions should be read in the following way: NWNE is the Northwest 1/4 of the Northeast 1/4.
GSEQKY: The Land Records sequence number, a primary key in the Land Records.
DNRDOCNO: DNR document number
CTYDOCNO: County Document number.
LCTPIN: County PIN number
LACRES: The number of acres that have a State-owned interest within the PLS forty or government covered by this record.
LPCT40: The percent of the surface area of the PLS forty or government lot that is state owned. LPCT40 = LACRES/(GLO acres for the forty or government lot) * 100. If the number is less than 100, this record does not include the entire forty or government lot.
LSFOWN: State surface ownership.
LSRPCT: Surface undivided interest given as a percentage.
LMINOW: State owned mineral interest
LMINPCT: Mineral undivided interest given as a percentage.
LINTAQ: Type of ownership interest as a 1-character code.
XINTAQ: Type of ownership interest as a text description.
LLNDTP: Land type as a 1-character code.
XLNDTP: Land type as a text description.
LMNSAQ: Means of acquisition as a 1-character code.
XMNSAQ: Means of acquisition as a text description.
PUADMNAME: DNR public use administrator name.
PUPGM: DNR public use administrator program as a 3-character code.
PUPGMNAME: DNR public use administrator program name.
PUPRJ: DNR public use administrator project code as a 5-digit number.
PUPJNAME: DNR public use administrator program/project name.
LADMIN: DNR administrator code as a 2-digit number.
LMGPGM: DNR administrator management program as a 3-character code.
LMGPRJ: DNR administrator program/project as an 8-character code.
CHGDATE: Land Record change date, given as MM/DD/YYYY. Indicates when the record was added or last changed.
DOWNLOAD: Download date - the date when the record was downloaded from the Land Records and matched to PLS40
RDIR: PLS Range direction as a number, 0, 1, or 2, rather than West, East, West - half township or half range
GLTMCH: The geocoding field used to match the Land Records to the PLS40 base layer. The format of this field is as follows: CCTTTDRRSSFFGG, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, RR is RANG, SS is SECT, FF is FORT or "00" (see following note), and GG is GLOT. Note: if the GLOT is greater than 0, such as government lot 1, the FF part of GLOTMATCH is set to 00.
GEOSECT: A PLS description to the section level. It is a combination of the COUN, TOWN, RDIR, RANG, and SECT fields. The format of this field is as follows: CCTTTDRRSS, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, and SS is SECT.
GEORANG: A PLS description to the township and range level. It is a combination of the COUN, TOWN, RDIR, and RANG fields. The format of this field is as follows: CCTTTDRR, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, and RR is RANG.
COUNTXT: The county name.
FORT: PLS forty number (that is, the quarter-quarter section), rather than a text description such as NWNE. (FORT is based on the MLMIS40 codes that have been used in the state for many years.) In cases where there is a government lot, the FORT code provides a locational reference to where the government lot can be found in the section.
TOWNDIR: PLS township direction listed as N - North.
RANGDIR: PLS Range direction where W - West and E - East.
LFORTY: An old, Bureau of Real Estate Management Land Records code for PLS forties - intended for internal use only. Generally matches the FORT field (which is LMAP40 in the Land Records), but there are additional values for fractional forties and references to other information.
LTRAN_NUM: Transaction number, listed as six characters.
LCHGYR: Land Record added or last changed - year, given as a 4-digit number.
LCHGMN: Land Record added or changed - month, given as a 2-digit number.
LCHGDY: Land Record added or last changed - day, given as a 2-digit number.
XMGPRJ: DNR administrator program/project name.
XMGPGM: DNR administrator program name.
XADMIN: DNR administrator name.
PUPRGRPJ: DNR public use administrator program/project code as a combination of PUPGM and PUPRJ fields.
PUADMIN: DNR public use administrator as a 2-digit code. In several locations around the state, there is more than one DNR administrator. The PUADMIN field indicates the designated administrator of the public use and is used for determining payment-in-liew of taxes (PILT).
LREGIN: DNR Region as a 1-digit number.
LARDST: DNR Region area (field unit) code.
LTRAN_TYP: Transaction type, given as a 2-character code.
LACQDT: Acquisition date given as a number in the following format: YYYYMMDD where YYYY is the 4-digit year, MM is the 2-digit month, and DD is the 2-digit day.
XACQDT: Acquisition date given as a text field, formatted as follows: MM/DD/YYYY, where MM is month, DD is day, and YYYY is year.
LDOCTP: DNR Document type as a 1-character code. Refer to the XDOCTP field in the dataset for a list of the text descriptions for document type.
XDOCTP: DNR document type as a text description.
overview.eadetcit:
Value Domain for Data Element COUN: 1 = Aitkin 2 = Anoka 3 = Becker 4 = Beltrami 5 = Benton 6 = Big Stone 7 = Blue Earth 8 = Brown 9 = Carlton 10 = Carver 11 = Cass 12 = Chippewa 13 = Chisago 14 = Clay 15 = Clearwater 16 = Cook 17 = Cottonwood 18 = Crow Wing 19 = Dakota 20 = Dodge 21 = Douglas 22 = Faribault 23 = Fillmore 24 = Freeborn 25 = Goodhue 26 = Grant 27 = Hennepin 28 = Houston 29 = Hubbard 30 = Isanti 31 = Itasca 32 = Jackson 33 = Kanabec 34 = Kandiyohi 35 = Kittson 36 = Koochiching 37 = Lac Qui Parle 38 = Lake 39 = Lake of the Woods 40 = LeSueur 41 = Lincoln 42 = Lyon 43 = McLeod 44 = Mahnomen 45 = Marshall 46 = Martin 47 = Meeker 48 = Mille Lacs 49 = Morrison 50 = Mower 51 = Murray 52 = Nicollet 53 = Nobles 54 = Norman 55 = Olmsted 56 = Otter Tail 57 = Pennington 58 = Pine 59 = Pipestone 60 = Polk 61 = Pope 62 = Ramsey 63 = Red Lake 64 = Redwood 65 = Renville 66 = Rice 67 = Rock 68 = Roseau 69 = St. Louis 70 = Scott 71 = Sherburne 72 = Sibley 73 = Stearns 74 = Steele 75 = Stevens 76 = Swift 77 = Todd 78 = Traverse 79 = Wabasha 80 = Wadena 81 = Waseca 82 = Washington 83 = Watonwan 84 = Wilkin 85 = Winona 86 = Wright 87 = Yellow Medicine
Value Domain for Data Element LSFOWN: Y = Yes N = No U = Uncertain - generally means that there is a transaction in process
Value Domain for Data Element LMINOW: Y = Yes N = No U = Uncertain - State asserts that it owns minerals, not researched
Value Domain for Data Element LINTAQ: A = Agreement B = Life estate C = Conservation restriction E = Easement F = Fee L = Lease O = Other W = Waterbank agreement
Value Domain for Data Element LLNDTP: 1 = School trust (School trust) 2 = Indemnity School trust (School trust) 3 = Swamp trust (School trust) 4 = Internal improvement (School trust) 5 = University trust (University trust) 6 = Transferred University trust (University trust) 7 = Transferred School trust (School trust) 8 = Agricultural School trust 9 = Public Building trust A = Acquired C = Consolidated Conservation O = Other - non-state R = Rural Credit T = Tax forfeited V = Volstead Act F = Federal - state lease M = Severed minerals
Value Domain for Data Element LMNSAQ: B = County Board resolution C = Condemnation D = Rural Credit E = Exchange F = Forfeited general property tax G = Gift L = Leased by State O = Other P = Purchase R = Reversion S = State transfer U = Congressional Grant, Patent, Deed, Etc. 1 = Tax-forfeited severed minerals 2 = Forfeited non-registered severed minerals 3 = Non-registered severed minerals 4 = Gift severed minerals
Value Domain for Data Element LADMIN: 01 = MN Department of Natural Resources 30 = Wildlife Section 33 = Division of Ecological Services 35 = Fisheries Section 40 = Division of Enforcement 41 = Division of Forestry 42 = Division of Minerals 43 = Division of Parks and Recreation 44 = Division of Waters 50 = Metro Greenways 62 = Trails and Waterways 80 = County: Miscellaneous 81 = County: Forest 82 = County: Park 90 = MN Department of Transportation 92 = IRRRB 98 = Divisions of Minerals and Waters 99 = No Administrator
Value Domain for Data Element LMGPGM: AMA = Aquatic Management Area CBR = Canoe and Boating Route DNR = DNR Unit EED = Environmental Education ENF = Division of Enforcement FMA = Fish Management Area MIN = Division of Minerals OHV = Off-Highway Vehicle SFT = State Forest SNA = Scientific and Natural Area SPK = State Park SRA = State Recreation Area SWS = State Wayside TRA = State Trail WAS = Water Access Site WAT = Waters Dam Site WBK = Water Bank WBP = Wetland Bank Project WMA = Wildlife Management Area WSR = Wild and Scenic River
Value Domain for Data Element RDIR: 0 = East 1 = West 2 = West, but represents a half township (T58.5N R17W in St. Louis county) or half range (T160N R42.5W and T159N R42.5W in Roseau county)
Value Domain for Data Element FORT: 11 = NENE 12 = NWNE 13 = SWNE 14 = SENE 21 = NENW 22 = NWNW 23 = SWNW 24 = SENW 31 = NESW 32 = NWSW 33 = SWSW 34 = SESW 41 = NESE 42 = NWSE 43 = SWSE 44 = SESE 15 = First government lot East of NENE 16 = First government lot East of SENE 45 = First government lot East of NESE 46 = First government lot East of SESE 01 = First government lot South of SESE 02 = First government lot South of SWSE 05 = First government lot South of SESW 06 = First government lot South of SWSW 71 = First government lot West of NWNW 74 = First government lot West of SWNW 81 = First government lot West of NWSW 84 = First government lot West of SWSW 72 = Second government lot West of NWNW 73 = Second government lot West of SWNW 82 = Second government lot West of NWSW 83 = Second government lot West of SWSW 75 = Third government lot West of NWNW 78 = Third government lot West of SWNW 85 = Third government lot West of NWSW 88 = Third government lot West of SWSW 54 = First government lot North of NENE 53 = First government lot North of NWNE 64 = First government lot North of NENW 63 = First government lot North of NWNW 51 = Second government lot North of NENE 52 = Second government lot North of NWNE 61 = Second government lot North of NENW 62 = Second government lot North of NWNW 58 = Third government lot North of NENE 57 = Third government lot North of NWNE 68 = Third government lot North of NENW 67 = Third government lot North of NWNW 94 = First government lot Northwest of NWNW
Value Domain for Data Element LFORTY: 11 = NE NE 12 = NW NE 13 = SW NE 14 = SE NE 15 = Fractional NE NE 16 = Fractional NW NE 17 = Fractional SW NE 18 = Fractional SE NE 21 = NE NW 22 = NW NW 23 = SW NW 24 = SE NW 25 = Fractional NE NW 26 = Fractional NW NW 27 = Fractional SW NW 28 = Fractional SE NW 31 = NE SW 31 = NE SW 32 = NW SW 32 = NW SW 33 = SW SW 33 = SW SW 34 = SE SW 34 = SE SW 35 = Fractional NE SW 36 = Fractional NW SW 37 = Fractional SW SW 38 = Fractional SE SW 41 = NE SE 42 = NW SE 43 = SW SE 44 = SE SE 45 = Fractional NE SE 46 = Fractional NW SE 47 = Fractional SW SE 48 = Fractional SE SE 98 = Other - see status card in Land Records
Value Domain for Data Element LDOCTP: $ = Statute * = Release of Easement # = Intra-department Land Exchange @ = Flowage Easement A = Waterbank Agreement B = Certificate of Cancellation or Acceptance C = Certificate of Sale D = Deed E = Severed Mineral Interest Statute F = Final Certificate G = Certificate of Acceptance H = Conservator's Deed I = Interdepartment Land Transfer J = Judgment K = Conservation Easement L = Limited Warranty Deed M = Conveyance of Forfeited Lands N = Contract for Deed O = Commissioner's Order P = Patent or Deed from USA Q = Quit Claim Deed R = County Board Resolution S = Patent from State T = Transfer of Custodial Control U = Auditor's Certificate V = Conservation Restriction W = Warranty Deed X = Probate Deed Y = Per Representative's Deed Z = Other 0 = Perpetual Easement 1 = Temporary Easement 2 = Perpetual Lease 3 = Temporary Lease 4 = Perpetual License 5 = Temporary License 6 = Perpetual Agreement 7 = Temporary Agreement 8 = Perpetual Permit 9 = Temporary Permit
